item.title: India vs Australia LIVE, 5th Test, Day 2: India's MCG Hero Steps Up After Jasprit Bumrah Leaves Stadium - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Score, 5th Test, Day 2: Despite Jasprit Bumrah's Absence, India Dominate Australia To Take 4-Run Lead

Date: 2025-01-04 | Source: NDTV Sports

India has taken a narrow lead of 4 runs against Australia on Day 2 of the 5th Test, after bowling out Australia for 181. With Jasprit Bumrah injured, India's bowling performance was led by Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna, each taking three wickets.

  • India scored 185 runs in their first innings.
  • Australia was bowled out for 181, trailing by 4 runs.
  • Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna stood out with three wickets each.
  • Beau Webster was the top scorer for Australia with 57 runs on his Test debut.
  • Steve Smith contributed with a score of 33 runs.
Rohit Sharma said, "People on the outside sitting with laptop, pen and paper don't decide when retirement will come and what decisions I need to take."

The absence of Jasprit Bumrah presents a significant challenge for India, but they maintain a slight edge going into the next innings, needing to build on this momentum.

item.title: Rohit Sharma To Retire After India vs Australia Series? Star Says: "I Am Father Of 2..." - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Rohit Sharma To Retire After India vs Australia Series? Star Says: "I Am Father Of 2..."

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NDTV Sports

India's captain, Rohit Sharma, has decided to miss the fifth Test against Australia due to poor form, igniting speculation regarding his retirement from Test cricket. At 38, and with India not scheduled for another Test in over five months, this decision raises questions about his future in the sport.

  • Rohit confirmed he is not retiring, stating he wants to focus on the present and continue playing for the team.
  • The decision to rest was taken in agreement with the coach and selectors, citing a need for a strong performance.
  • He emphasized the importance of understanding the team's needs over personal form.
  • Rohit mentioned this is not the end, implying he has more to offer in the future.
“I don’t believe in what happens five months later. I want to focus on the present. This decision is not retirement decision.”

Rohit's decision also allowed for Shubman Gill to step into a key role in the match, highlighting the importance of teamwork in cricket.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah leaves the Sydney Cricket Ground with team doctor - The Times of India
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Leaves SCG Amid Concerns Following Injury

Date: Saturday, Publication Source: Times of India

Jasprit Bumrah left the Sydney Cricket Ground with India's team doctor during a match against Australia, raising concerns about his health after he exited shortly after bowling.

  • Bumrah returned after lunch but bowled only one over before leaving the field.
  • He is being rushed for scans, although there has been no official statement confirming the severity of any injury.
  • During the match, Bumrah took the wicket of Marnus Labuschagne, increasing his series tally to 32—surpassing the previous record held by Bishan Singh Bedi.
  • His performance has been crucial for India, and his absence could significantly impact the team's chances in the match.
"India would hope there is nothing serious because he has been their MVP this series and they can't afford to lose his services midway through the match."

This incident highlights the importance of player health and the potential impact of injuries on team performance.

item.title: India vs Australia 5th Test Day 2 LIVE Score: Injury scare for Bumrah, good start for AUS after Lunch - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Score, 5th Test Day 2

Date: January 4, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

India vs Australia are locked in a fierce contest during the 5th Test, with both teams vying for vital points. Jasprit Bumrah's injury scare looms large as he has been off the ground after bowling only one over after Lunch.

  • Australia was 101/5 at Lunch, trailing India by 84 runs.
  • Jasprit Bumrah dismissed Marnus Labuschagne early in the day before struggling with fitness.
  • Prasidh Krishna secured key wickets including Steve Smith and Alex Carey.
  • An under-pressure Indian batting line-up, unable to stabilize in their previous innings.
  • The Test match holds significant implications for both teams concerning the Border-Gavaskar Trophy and the World Test Championship.
“An injury to Bumrah is arguably the one thing India dread the most, with the pacer being the visitors' only consistent performer throughout the series.”

The outcome of this match is crucial for both teams, with significant ramifications for future series and rankings.

item.title: India vs Australia 5th Test Day 2 LIVE Score: IND's early momentum dies out as Smith, Webster calm things down for AUS - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia 5th Test Day 2 LIVE Score: Bumrah off the field, Kohli leading IND early in 2nd session

Date: [Date not provided] Source: Hindustan Times

The live action continues as India faces Australia in the 5th Test, with significant stakes for both teams. After losing key wickets, India aims to maintain pressure on the Australian batting lineup.

  • India started strong, with Bumrah dismissing Labuschagne and Siraj following up with key wickets.
  • At Lunch, Australia was 101/5, trailing by 84 runs.
  • The conditions at SCG favor pace bowlers, making it a challenging day for batters.
  • Ongoing controversies include Rohit Sharma's absence from the squad due to form issues.
Rohit Sharma stated, “I am not getting runs. No guarantee that it will be the same a few months later.”

This Test is crucial, as it affects future championships for both teams.

item.title: Rohit Sharma, Gautam Gambhir, Ajit Agarkar Meeting: What Happened Before India Captain's 'Big' Decis.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Rohit Sharma, Gautam Gambhir, Ajit Agarkar Meeting: What Happened Before India Captain's 'Big' Decision

This article discusses an important meeting involving Indian cricket captain Rohit Sharma, Gautam Gambhir, and Ajit Agarkar, focusing on the developments leading up to a significant decision concerning the team.

item.title: Virat Kohli asks SCG crowd to roar after Mohammed Siraj sends Sam Konstas packing at SCG - The Times of India
item.description:
Virat Kohli asks SCG crowd to roar after Mohammed Siraj sends Sam Konstas packing at SCG

Date: Not provided Source: Times of India

The second day of the fifth Test at the Sydney Cricket Ground (SCG) showcased high-octane action as Mohammed Siraj took center stage with a remarkable bowling performance.

  • India scored a modest 185 runs in their first innings.
  • Siraj dismissed Sam Konstas and Travis Head in a game-changing over.
  • Virat Kohli energized the crowd by urging them to support the team.
  • Australia leads the series 2-1 and needs a win or draw to reclaim the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • India must win to level the series and retain the trophy.
“Kohli then turned to the crowd, waving his arms to fire them up, adding to the electrifying atmosphere at the SCG.”

This match is critical for both teams as they vie for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, reflecting their recent performances in Australia.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE, 5th Test, Day 2: Jasprit Bumrah Shatters 47-Year Old Record, Siraj Breathes Fire - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Score, 5th Test, Day 2: Jasprit Bumrah Breaks Record

Date: Not specified Source: NDTV Sports

India is taking on Australia in the 5th Test and Jasprit Bumrah has recently shattered a significant record.

  • Live updates from the Test match between India and Australia.
  • Jasprit Bumrah's record-breaking performance highlighted.
  • Key moments and player performances tracked throughout the day.
"Jasprit Bumrah has delivered an exceptional performance that is worth noting in the annals of cricket history."

This match is crucial in the context of the series and both teams are looking to capitalize on every opportunity.

item.title: ‘Reminds me of a young Kohli…’: Gavaskar dissects Sam Konstas’ altercation with Jasprit Bumrah, gives a Watson reminder - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Gavaskar Comments on Konstas-Bumrah Altercation, Draws Kohli Comparison

Date: Jan 04, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

The cricket community is buzzing after an on-field altercation between Sam Konstas and Jasprit Bumrah during the fifth Border-Gavaskar Trophy Test match. Sunil Gavaskar stated that Konstas' behavior reminded him of a young Virat Kohli.

  • Kohli's aggressive demeanor as a young player was highlighted in comparison to Konstas.
  • The altercation occurred in the final over of Day 1 with Bumrah responding to Konstas' remarks.
  • Gavaskar suggested that while such behavior can stir excitement, it’s risky and could lead to targeting from opponents.
  • Konstas is advised to manage his newfound aggressive image as it could impact his reputation.
“It’s not about the batting; it’s about what happens on the field when someone’s behaviour stirs things up... it reminds me of a young Kohli.” - Sunil Gavaskar

Gavaskar warned that if Konstas continues to provoke, he will likely become a target for the opposing players.

item.title: Girls Sports Company: Inside Indian Army’s mission to turn teenage girls into champion athletes - The Indian Express
item.description:
Girls Sports Company: Inside Indian Army’s Mission to Turn Teenage Girls into Champion Athletes

Publication Date: N/A Source: Indian Express

This article highlights the Indian Army's initiative aimed at transforming teenage girls into elite athletes through specialized training at the Army Sports Institute in Pune.

  • The Army Sports Institute hosts various sports training, including archery and weightlifting.
  • Training is designed to enhance skills and competitiveness in young female athletes.
  • Emphasis on discipline and rigorous training is evident in the atmosphere of the Institute.
“There’s an out-of-rhythm thump-thump-thump beat that punctuates the quiet afternoon air at the sprawling Army Sports Institute.”

Overall, this initiative reflects a commitment to promoting women's sports in India and nurturing talent from a young age.

item.title: IND vs AUS: Jasprit Bumrah breaks India legend's record - The Times of India
item.description:
IND vs AUS: Jasprit Bumrah breaks India legend's record

Date: Saturday, Publication Source: Times of India

India's star pacer Jasprit Bumrah has surpassed a long-standing record held by spin legend Bishan Singh Bedi for the most wickets by an Indian bowler in a Test series in Australia, achieving a remarkable 32 wickets in the ongoing 2024/25 Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Bumrah's record-breaking achievement occurred during the 2024/25 Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • He dismissed Marnus Labuschagne to secure his 32nd wicket, surpassing Bedi’s 31 wickets from the 1977/78 series.
  • India needs a win in the final match to level the series 2-2 and retain the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
“Most wickets for India in a series in Australia:
32 wickets - Jasprit Bumrah (2024/25)
31 wickets - Bishan Bedi (1977/78)

This accomplishment highlights Bumrah's significant role in India's cricketing success in Australia over the years.

item.title: Sam Konstas slammed for altercation with Jasprit Bumrah - The Times of India
item.description:
Sam Konstas Faces Criticism for Heated Exchange with Jasprit Bumrah

Date: Not specified | Source: Times of India

Australian opener Sam Konstas has come under fire for a heated argument with India captain Jasprit Bumrah during the SCG Test.

  • Konstas engaged in a furious exchange with Bumrah before Usman Khawaja's dismissal.
  • The altercation led to India celebrating Khawaja's wicket and marked a tense finale to day one.
  • Reports suggest Konstas' behavior may have distracted Khawaja from finishing the day's play smoothly.
  • Adam Gilchrist criticized Konstas, highlighting the unusual and intense nature of the celebration from the Indian team.
"They're charging in from everywhere … All sorts of drama here," said Adam Gilchrist. "It was Bumrah who turned to Konstas. He learns a tough lesson in his second Test match."

The incident has sparked widespread discussion and criticism among commentators and former players regarding the balance between confidence and unsportsmanlike conduct.

item.title: Real Madrid player ratings vs Valencia: Jude Bellingham rescues loony Los Blancos! England star makes up for penalty miss with late winner after Vinicius Junior sees red card in chaotic clash against La Liga strugglers - Goal.com
item.description:
Jude Bellingham's Late Heroics Lead Real Madrid to Victory Against Valencia

Publication Date: [Date Not Provided] Source: Goal

Real Madrid faced a chaotic match at Mestalla, managing to secure a 2-1 victory over Valencia despite missing a penalty and a red card for Vinicius Jr.

  • Real Madrid fell behind to Valencia after an early goal by Hugo Duro.
  • Jude Bellingham missed a penalty in the second half, hitting the post.
  • Vinicius Junior received a red card late in the match, adding to Madrid's struggles.
  • Luka Modric equalized in the 84th minute, followed by a late winner from Bellingham.
  • The comeback victory displayed Real Madrid's resilience under pressure.
“But Madrid stayed alive, Luka Modric equalising off the bench with six minutes in normal time remaining.”

This match underscores Real Madrid's fighting spirit, showcasing their ability to secure crucial victories, even when facing adversity.

item.title: Real Madrid player ratings vs Valencia: Jude Bellingham rescues loony Los Blancos! England star makes up for penalty miss with late winner after Vinicius Junior sees red card in chaotic clash against La Liga strugglers - GOAL English
item.description:

item.title: 'Wicket Was Doing Too Much': Rishabh Pant Explains Change In His Batting Approach For Sydney Test - News18
item.description:
Wicket Was Doing Too Much: Rishabh Pant Explains Change In His Batting Approach For Sydney Test

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: News18

In the fifth Test in Sydney, Rishabh Pant revealed that the challenging pitch conditions necessitated a more defensive batting approach during the first innings.

  • Pant, typically an aggressive batsman, was the top-scorer for India, making 40 runs off 98 balls as the team was all out for 185.
  • He noted that the wicket was playing difficult, influencing his decision to play conservatively.
  • Pant expressed that adapting to game situations is essential for his growth as a player.
  • Despite a disappointing first innings, he remains hopeful for competitive play moving forward.
“I think in this innings, I was not in a frame of mind where I wanted to take charge of the game because the wicket was doing too much,” Pant stated.

The match's evolving conditions and Pant's adaptability reflect the challenges faced by the Indian team in the ongoing Test series.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah's Aggressive Celebration After Taking Usman Khawaja's Wicket Goes Viral: Watch - News18
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah's Aggressive Celebration After Taking Usman Khawaja's Wicket Goes Viral: Watch

Date: January 03, 2025 | Source: News18

Indian captain Jasprit Bumrah celebrated aggressively after dismissing Australian opener Usman Khawaja during the fifth India-Australia Test at Sydney Cricket Ground. The video of his celebration has gone viral on social media.

  • Khawaja was dismissed for 2 runs off 10 balls on the last ball of Day 1.
  • Bumrah's celebration was directed towards Sam Konstas after grabbing Khawaja's wicket.
  • This wicket marked Bumrah's 31st dismissal in the series, equaling Bishan Singh Bedi's record.
Bumrah has matched former great Bishan Singh Bedi's record of 31 wickets in Test series played in Australia.

If Bumrah secures one more wicket during the ongoing match, he will hold the record for the most wickets in an India-Australia Test series.

item.title: India To Announce Squad For ICC Champions Trophy 2025 By Second Week Of January: Report - News18
item.description:
India To Announce Squad For ICC Champions Trophy 2025 By Second Week Of January: Report

Date: January 03, 2025

Source: News18

India is preparing to announce its final squad for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025 by the second week of January, following an eight-year hiatus for the tournament.

  • The tournament will kick off on February 19 in Karachi, with the final on March 9 in either Lahore or Dubai.
  • India's opening match will be against Bangladesh on February 20, followed by a high-profile clash with Pakistan on February 23.
  • The deadline for squad submissions is January 12, but reports suggest India's squad may be announced on January 11.
  • The tournament will follow a hybrid model, with matches held in Pakistan and Dubai.
“Dubai will host India’s semifinal match (if qualified) on March 4, and the final is scheduled to take place at the same venue on March 9.”

The upcoming Champions Trophy marks an important event for the Indian cricket team to regroup and showcase their strength after a series of challenges.

item.title: Ayub ruled out of Newlands Test due to ankle injuey - Cricbuzz
item.description:
Saim Ayub Ruled Out of Newlands Test Due to Ankle Injury

Published on: Fri, Jan 3, 2025, 05:27 PM

Pakistan opener Saim Ayub has been ruled out of the ongoing Newlands Test with an ankle injury. The 22-year-old twisted his right ankle while fielding on the opening day of the second Test against South Africa, and his recovery timeline remains uncertain.

  • The injury occurred in the seventh over when Ayub slipped while attempting to field a ball.
  • He underwent X-rays and MRI tests, with reports sent to specialists in London for further advice.
  • Ayub will not participate further in the second Test and was seen in a cast after the incident.
  • He was replaced by Abdullah Shafique in the field.
  • The injury contributed to a challenging day for Pakistan, facing significant scores from South Africa's Ryan Rickelton and Temba Bavuma.
“Saim has been ruled out of further participation in the second men's cricket Test against South Africa after twisting his right ankle while fielding,” the PCB stated.

This injury poses concerns for Pakistan as they navigate a tough match against South Africa.

item.title: India vs Australia 5th Test, Sydney Weather Report: Will rain impact IND vs AUS match on Day 2? - The Times of India
item.description:
India vs Australia 5th Test, Sydney Weather Report: Will rain impact IND vs AUS match on Day 2?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

The fifth and final Test between India and Australia at the Sydney Cricket Ground enters Day 2, with clear skies promising uninterrupted action after a dramatic opening day.

Sydney Day 2 Weather: Morning Conditions

  • Morning temperature: 27°C, mostly sunny and breezy.
  • Wind: Northeast at 19 km/h with gusts up to 39 km/h.
  • Probability of rainfall: 2%.

IND vs AUS Weather Forecast: Afternoon Conditions

  • Afternoon temperature: 28°C, conditions remain mostly sunny and windy.
  • Wind increases to 30 km/h with gusts up to 48 km/h.
  • Probability of rainfall: 1%.

With no significant rain interruptions expected, both sides can fully focus on gameplay strategies as Australia looks to build a strong response to India's modest first innings total.

item.title: Average Less Than Jasprit Bumrah: Virat Kohli's Embarrassing Record A New Low - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Average Less Than Jasprit Bumrah: Virat Kohli's Embarrassing Record A New Low

Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: NDTV

Virat Kohli's struggles continue as he records the second-lowest Test batting average since 2024, raising questions about his future in the sport.

  • Kohli scored only 17 runs in the first innings of the SCG Test.
  • His dismissal came after he faced 68 balls, with a catch taken by Australian debutant Beau Webster.
  • Kohli's current average is 7, less than other bowlers in the top rankings.
  • He had a lifeline when Steve Smith dropped a catch off his first ball.
  • Another failure could lead to his exclusion from the Test squad.
"If Kohli fails again, his return to India's Test side could also be in jeopardy."

The pressure on Kohli mounts as the series comes to a close, and his recent performance raises concerns about his place in the team moving forward.

item.title: 'Whoever has dropped Rohit Sharma; be it Gambhir or selectors...': BCCI reminded Virat Kohli hasn't scored runs either - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mohammad Kaif Critiques Selectors for Dropping Rohit Sharma in Sydney Test

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Former Indian cricketer Mohammad Kaif expressed his disagreement with the team management regarding the decision to drop captain Rohit Sharma from the playing XI for the crucial Sydney Test against Australia. He believed that the captain should have been included irrespective of recent performances.

  • Kaif highlighted that dropping Rohit Sharma, especially before a crucial match, sends the wrong message.
  • He pointed out that several top batsmen, including Virat Kohli, are also struggling to score runs.
  • Amidst criticism, Kaif emphasized that Sharma's leadership qualities are essential for the team.
  • Reports suggest that this could be Rohit Sharma's last Test after missing the series opener due to personal reasons.
"You cannot drop him. The captain can never be dropped. If you win, it's with the captain; if you lose, you lose with the captain." - Mohammad Kaif

Kaif's remarks have sparked discussions among fans and analysts about player selection and team dynamics, especially in high-stakes matches.

item.title: Watch: Anushka Sharma's Reaction After Virat Kohli Almost Falls For First-Ball Duck Goes Viral - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Anushka Sharma's Reaction to Virat Kohli's Close Call Goes Viral

Publication Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: NDTV

Indian cricket star Virat Kohli faced a near-dismissal on his first ball during the fifth Test match against Australia, with his wife Anushka Sharma's reaction going viral.

  • Kohli was dismissed for 17 runs, contributing to India's tough start at 17/2.
  • He narrowly avoided a catch on the first ball, deemed not out after a review.
  • Anushka's response to Kohli's scare captured social media attention.
  • His latest performance puts him among players with the lowest averages since 2024 in Test first innings.
  • Kohli's ongoing struggles have raised concerns among fans and analysts alike.
“His struggles with outside off stump deliveries continued.”

The incident showcases not only Kohli's batting challenges but also the emotional support from his wife, which resonates with fans during difficult sporting moments.

item.title: Watch: Steve Smith Gives Fiery Send-Off To Shubman Gill In Sydney Test - News18
item.description:
Watch: Steve Smith Gives Fiery Send-Off To Shubman Gill In Sydney Test

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: News18

In the first innings of the 5th India-Australia Test at the Sydney Cricket Ground, Shubman Gill fell short of expectations, scoring only 20 runs before being dismissed by Nathan Lyon. Steve Smith's catch led to a lively celebration among the Australian players.

  • Shubman Gill scored 20 runs from 64 balls.
  • He replaced Rohit Sharma in India’s playing XI.
  • Gill was dismissed just before lunch on Day 1.
  • Steve Smith caught Gill's outside edge, celebrating with high-fives.
“Shubman Gill, this is downright embarrassing. Smith and Labuschagne owned Shubman in the mindgames here. This is way worse than ‘Mind the windows, Tino’” — Savage SiyaRam

Gill has struggled throughout the series, contributing minimally to India's performance, which has faced challenges with its top order.
